thread.title: Toronto FC star Jozy Altidore red-carded without taking to the pitch
thread.title_full: Toronto FC star Jozy Altidore red-carded without taking to the pitch

title: Toronto FC star Jozy Altidore red-carded without taking to the pitch
text:
Outspoken: Jozy Altidore in action for the USA against Mexico on Saturday. Photo: AP
How do you get sent-off without even being on the football pitch?
Just ask former English Premier League player Jozy Altidore, who was given a red card while sitting on the bench for Toronto FC during their MLS game against New York Red Bulls on Thursday (AEDT).
The ex-Sunderland player was given his marching orders for foul and abusive language towards the fourth official while seated in the players dug-out.
The incident occurred in the 33nd minute with the scores locked at nil-all. Despite protests from his teammates, Altidore was ejected from the sidelines for the straight red card.
Advertisement It was the 87-cap international's third sending off of 2015.
The USA representative was also sent from the field – while actually playing – for foul language during a friendly against Switzerland in March having disputed a yellow card.
He has captained the international side in the absence of regular skipper Michael Bradley.
Toronto FC would go on to win despite 2-1 to qualify for their first Major League Soccer playoffs with Italian international Sebastian Giovinco starring.
